meanings.definition: To exclude someone from a group or organization by popular consent.
meanings.sent1: The group decided to blackball the new member from joining their club.
meanings.sent2: He was blackballed from the team because of his behavior.
meanings.sent3: It was like being blackballed from the cool kids' table at lunch.
meanings.sent4: She felt as if she had been blackballed from all social gatherings.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of being blackballed were severe and isolating.

meanings.definition: A negative vote against a candidate for membership in a club or organization.
meanings.sent1: The blackball against him prevented his entry into the exclusive club.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a blackball can be disheartening for aspiring members.
meanings.sent3: The blackball in the voting box stood out among the white ones.
meanings.sent4: The blackball symbolized rejection and disappointment for the candidate.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the blackball in the decision process was palpable.

meanings.definition: To reject or ostracize someone socially or professionally.
meanings.sent1: She felt hurt when her colleagues blackballed her from the project.
meanings.sent2: Being blackballed by the industry made it hard for him to find work.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was blackballed from the office coffee club.
meanings.sent4: The competitive nature of the field often led to people being blackballed.
meanings.sent5: The fear of being blackballed kept many from speaking up against injustice.
